Hey all, I've just been getting back into the game after a while of not playing and I've decided to have a go at using the KAS (Kerbal Attachment System), however, when I attempt to lower the winch (with an electro-magnet attached) the electro-magnet just falls of, no matter what I do. This happens with and without anything attached. Any ideas? This is a great mod and I'd love to be able to use it to help me build my bases.

Cheers!

Be sure that when attaching the electromagnet, you put it on the first of the two nodes that are on the KAS winch. There are actually two, if you look closely in the VAB. The upper is for the electromagnet/suction cup, and the lower is for your cargo, or anything you wish to preattach.

Hope this helps!

KAS has been a bit derpy as of late, I think it needs updating since it was only guaranteed to work with 0.18.2. Its forum thread got eaten in the database crash, so I dunno where it's going to go from here.

Yeah what he means is, if you have a craft that has both the KAS and the new wheels, then when you try to use the winch the magnet will fall off. If you take away the wheels from the craft then the KAS works fine. So what you have to do is first decouple the part of the craft that has the KAS from the part that has the wheels, then you can use the KAS just fine.

I did a Curiosity Rover style landing system and my god was that a fiddle because of this. During descent I had to first decouple the rover from the main descent vehicle and hold the rover inside the heat shield. So the rover was completely disconnected just resting against the inside of the descent stage, then I was able to lower the KAS onto the rover and pick it up. That was the only way I could get a Curiosity style winch lowering system working with the new wheels.

I made a vid with that in it which shows the shuffle I had to do to get the KAS to play nice - http://youtu.be/O1RzFaEF5Rg?t=10m23s
